intro: Pyrus melliana, commonly known as the golden apple tree, is a deciduous species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its ornamental value, featuring showy yellow flowers in early spring and vibrant orange to red fruits in autumn. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The tree typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and prefers well-drained soils. It is relatively cold-hardy and can thrive in temperate climates.
